trope_detail: Kirk ribs Spock in the ending about his heritage.
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope_detail: Kirk: 'Must be terrible having bad blood like that.' (about Spock's human half).
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope_detail: McCoy: 'Assuming you call that green stuff in your veins blood'.
Why is Spock is insensitive? | Spock: 'That's the way I am'.
McCoy makes remarks about Spock 'different' anatomy.
Kirk: 'I'm tired of your half-breed interference' Kirk (thinks this while in duplication machine).
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk-android insults Spock with half-breed comment.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: McCoy: 'The little bugs have no appetite for green blood'.
McCoy: 'Did you get a look at that little Juliet, that's a pretty exciting creature . Of course your personnal chemistry would prevent you from seeing that.'
Kirk: 'Leave any bigotry in your quarters, there's no room for it on the bridge'.
Lt. Bowman: 'I'm sick and tired of this machine'.
McCoy: 'â€¦those mathematically perfect brainwaves of yours.'
McCoy: 'You bet your pointed ears I am.' | Spock frowns, then Kirk laughs.
McCoy (to Spock): 'I'm sure you know the type (ambiuous scientists). Devoted to logic. Completely unemotional'.
Kirk insults Spock by telling him his father was a computer and his mother an encyclopedia.
Kirk purposely insults Spock to try to break the spore's hold.
Kirk (to Spock): 'I suspect you're becoming more and more human all the time'.
McCoy (to Spock): 'Did the Horta have anything to say about those ears?'.
Kirk: 'At times you seem quite human'.
ep_title: The City on the Edge of Forever

trope_detail: Spock says they drove the people of Vaal out of Eden. | Kirk: 'Are you casting me in the role of Satan?' | Spock: 'Not at all Captain.' | Kirk Is there anyone on this ship who even remotely looks like Satan?' | Spock: 'I am not aware of anyone who fits tthat description Captain.' | Kirk: 'No Mr. Spock, I didn't think you would.'
Spock: 'Dr. McCoy's potion is acting like all his potions. Turning my stomach.' | McCoy: 'If you're blood were red, instead of green, then you wouldn't have an upset stomach.'
Spock: 'In my view, a splendid example of repriocity.' | McCoy: 'It would take a computerized Vulcan mind such as yours to make that type of a statement.'
